newsitem.title: USA: FDA orders Phyne Pharmaceuticals drug off market.
newsitem.headline: FDA orders Phyne Pharmaceuticals drug off market.

text.p: U.S. Food and Drug Administration has issued a national alert on a drug that has been used to help people lose weight and reduce drug abuse, saying it was causing dangerous infections that could be fatal.
The FDA said in a statement released on Friday it had ordered the drug off the market and was investigating its makers and distributors.
It said it had received dozens of complaints from people who suffering from abscesses on parts of their bodies where the adrenal cortex extract had been injected.
The drug comes in a 30-milliliter vial from Hallmark Labs that is distributed by Phyne Pharmaceuticals of Scottsdale, Arizona, it said.
The administration said it had never approved the use of the extract, which comes from the adrenal glands of sheep and other animals.
The administration said the abscesses might have occurred because the drug had been poorly prepared or labelled.
Phyne officials could not be immediately reached for comment.
